meanings.definition: The amount of space above someone's head.
meanings.sent1: The headrooms in the attic were filled with old boxes and furniture.
meanings.sent2: Please be careful of the low headrooms in this old building.
meanings.sent3: The headrooms in the elevator were so low that even I had to duck!
meanings.sent4: Her ideas had no headrooms for creativity, stifling any new projects.
meanings.sent5: The headrooms in the cave were so vast, it felt like a cathedral.

meanings.definition: The maximum level of sound that can be produced without distortion.
meanings.sent1: The concert hall was designed with excellent headrooms for the best acoustics.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to adjust the audio equipment to stay within the headrooms.
meanings.sent3: The headrooms on the speakers were tested to ensure crystal-clear sound.
meanings.sent4: The band pushed the headrooms to the limit, creating a powerful performance.
meanings.sent5: The headrooms of the sound system were so precise, you could hear a pin drop.

meanings.definition: The ability to think clearly and make good decisions.
meanings.sent1: His headrooms were sharp, allowing him to solve the puzzle quickly.
meanings.sent2: Stress can sometimes cloud your headrooms and affect your judgment.
meanings.sent3: She relied on her headrooms to navigate through the tricky situation.
meanings.sent4: In times of crisis, it's important to rely on your headrooms to lead others.
meanings.sent5: The CEO's strong headrooms guided the company through turbulent times.
